summary: Changes the settings for the MO Configurator to include missing keys and corrects default values.  Also offers an alternate setup to make the Configurator more user friendly for STEP users.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][b]
[size=5]CAUTION: THIS IS IN ALPHA[/size][/b][/color]
 
DESCRIPTION
The ModOrganizer (MO) Configurator edits Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini files.  It’s a useful tool because it shows defaultvalues of ini settings (keys) and sets up rules around what you can enter.  This changes the Configurator Settings.jsonfile to the following:
·        Added keys from default ini files to “Basic” ifnot already there (I didn’t remove the “Basic” items already there).
·        Default values corrected for some of the keysbased on the default ini files.
·        Added several keys that were missing from theoriginal Configurator (see Added Keys below) (the Configurator description says
“Added Key”).
·        These changes only change Configurator setup andshould not affect values you have already inputted or change your ini files in
any way.
 
Optional(STEP version)
You don’tneed the Main version with optional files.
·        Adds STEP guide descriptions to originaldescription.
·        Swaps out “Basic” view keys with keys from:
o  STEP Core: [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/STEP:2.2.9]http://wiki.step-project.com/STEP:2.2.9[/url];and
o  STEP INI Guide: [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:Skyrim_INIs]http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:Skyrim_INIs[/url](as of 1/23/2015); and
o  STEP Help: [url=http://forum.step-project.com/topic/3758-shadow-optimization/]http://forum.step-project.com/topic/3758-shadow-optimization/[/url].
·        Non-Step keys are still there, just in “Advanced”view.
 
WARNING
·        The Configurator author may have intentionallyleft the missing keys off so use new keys at your own risk (see Added Keys
below)!
·        ENB users: you still need to manually removeiPresentInterval from SkyrimPrefs.ini.  Icould not get Configurator to make this change. But, you can add iPresentInterval = 1 to Skyrim.ini throughConfigurator.
·        I didn’t set up rules around range or valuelimits on many of the missing keys (see Added Keys below).
·        If you see a note that says “DEFAULT UKNOWN”,that means this is an added key and I don’t know what the default value was
supposed to be (f3PBoltTiltUpAngle).  Youwill NOT want to reset it to the default value in Configurator; if you want to
reset to default manually remove it from the ini file.
·        I don’t know all the keys missing from Configurator,I tried to find as many as I could for Skyrim.
·        The Configurator author had several keyshidden.  I didn’t change these.
 
REQUIREMENTS
ModOrganizer v1.2.17.  Not tested with otherversions.
 
MANUALINSTALLATION
1.      Close MO if running (not sure if necessary butit’s probably a good idea).
2.      In Mod Organizer\plugins\data\ backup yourSetting.json file
3.      Extract and replace Settings.json with thedownload file
4.      ENB users: you still need to manually removeiPresentInterval from SkyrimPrefs.ini and add iPresentInterval=1 to Skyrim.ini.  I couldn’t get configurator to make thischange.
 
UNINSTALLATION
1.      IMPORTANT if you want to revert the settings foradded keys you may want to delete them manually from the ini files rather than
setting them back in Configurator.
2.      Close MO if running
3.      Replace Settings.json with the backup you made
 
HOW TO HELP
I’m notexperienced with Java.  Honestly, I justcopied and pasted snippets from the original file.  So please let me know if you have anyissues!  I plan to add the Main file toMod Organizer if this helps people.
 
There aresome key pieces of information I don’t know right now:
·        Defaults/ranges for missing keys (see Added Keysbelow)
·        I don’t know if the order of keys/groupsmatter.  For the added keys, let me knowif you run into issue because they are not in order.  If not, I can make a version everythingarranged alphabetically.
·        If you are aware of other keys missing inConfigurator, let me know and I’ll add them.
·        If you want me to make a version that’s based onanother tweak guide, copy and paste and/or send me a link with a list of all
the changes and I’ll make an optional version with those keys in “Basic” view-
(no guarantees how long that will take).
 
ADDED KEYS
v0.01a
Skyrim.ini
 
[Camera]
fOverShoulderAddY(default unknown)
 
[Combat]
f3PBoltTiltUpAngle(default unknown)
 
[VATS]
uVATSRangedPercentSneak
uVATSRangedPercentGlobal
 
SkyrimPrefs.ini
 
[BlurShader]
bUseBlurShader
 
[BlurShaderHDR]
bDoHighDynamicRange
 
[Controls]
bMouseAcceleration
 
[Decals]
uMaxSkinDecalsPerActor
 
[Display]
iShadowSplitCount
sD3DDevice
 
[General]
fBrightLightColorB
fBrightLightColorG
fBrightLightColorR
 
[Launcher]
bEnableFileSelection
bShowAllResolutions
uLastAspectRatio
 
[NavMesh]
fObstacleAlpha
fCoverSideHighAlpha
fCoverSideLowAlpha
fEdgeFullAlpha
fEdgeHighAlpha
fEdgeLowAlpha
fTriangleFullAlpha
fTriangleHighAlpha
fTriangleLowAlpha
fLedgeBoxHalfHeight
fEdgeDistFromVert
fEdgeThickness
fPointSize
 
[Water]
iWaterReflectHeight
iWaterReflectWidth
bUseWaterDisplacements
bUseWaterRefractions
bUseWaterReflections
bUseWaterDepth
author: madduma
